name: The Inn at Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay, it has really friendly, welcoming and knowledgable staff, is situated in a lovely part of San Fransisco and the room we had was perfect - clean, large and very comfortable - I loved the bathrobes !
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, great location, lovely room

likes.disliked: — There was nothing I didn't like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived from the UK having been travelling for most of the day and it was great to get such a warm welcome from David at the front desk. Registration was carried out very efficiently and we were impressed with the spacious, clean and welcoming room we were given.
reviews.title: stay here and be happy--The INN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked David for advice on where to eat and he gave us four recommendations, all of which we tried over the following couple of days - Max, Scampos (I think the name was) , Four Seas and Finos.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was really good with a choice of cereal, croissants, bagels, pastries, yogurt, fruit etc.
reviews.title: Great boutique experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff were very friendly and more than willing to give us a hand with our luggage and order and hail taxi's for us
reviews.title: Amazing - and I got engaged

likes.liked: — Wine and Cheese / Breakfast with couples from all over the world

reviews.text: Couldn"t ask for a nicer hotel to stay at. Besides being in a great location, the hotel itself was so much nicer than I expected.The staff catered to our every whim. There was an expanded continental breakfast, wine & cheese every night, even baked cookies at 8:30 in the evening. This small 30 room hotel has really outdid itself in personal service.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel & staff

likes.disliked: — Can not think of one thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights over the July 4th weekend. The hotel has a fabulous location, great staff and service. They offered wonderful features like an evening wine & cheese hour and a great continental breakfast. We booked our room using Expedia, which makes me wonder if this had any affect on the location of our room assignment. We were located right beside the breakfast reception area. The noise from staff setting up the breakfast each morning distrubed our sleep. We were woke up at 6:45 a.m. to the sounds of clanging dishes and other usual kitchen noises. We also heard other guests enjoying their breakfast all morning long, as we tried to catch a few more moments of sleep. We did request a room change, but the hotel was fully occupied.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel...but...

likes.liked: — The wine & cheese reception, breakfast and location
likes.disliked: — The noise from the breakfast area

reviews.text: But all this said - we would stay at this hotel again. I would just request a room towards the back of the hotel, to ensure a quieter morning.
reviews.title: A treasure in the heart of San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While traveling to Napa and Sonoma Valley we stayed on either end of our trip here. What a great little boutique hotel at Union Square. From the minute we arrived, the front desk was nothing but cordial and helpful. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean, quiet, and comfortable. The evening wine and cheese was fun because we had such great conversation with other guests including a couple from New Zealand. The late evening cookies and tea were a nice touch before we went to bed after dinner on the town. The morning breakfast of pastries, croissants, yogurts and various breads to toast was filling. The coffee was outstanding and kept us going for the morning. We highly recommend this little gem to all who are traveling to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Inn at Union Square

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, lovely rooms, extra little complimentary touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week in May and loved the place. We normally stay in the bigger, more anonymous type of hotels and were a bit sceptical about staying in such a small hotel but it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Perfect start to our honeymoon
Great Little Inn
reviews.text: We have stayed at the hotel two years in a row now based on my parents' recommendations. The hotel location right on Union Square cannot be beat -you have plenty of nearby shops, for when you may have forgotten something, or just want to splurge in the fancier Union Square stores like Macy's. There are also plenty of restaurants, from little independent coffee shops, sandwich stores, to beautiful restaurants, Michael Mina and Postrio. Try Scala on Powell - moderately priced Italian, but very busy. We have stayed in the two-room suites, which for their price are very reasonable. The separate sitting-room is nice as one of us could stay up if the other wanted to rest. We travelled with our toddler whom we could put to bed early in the back bedroom. The room amenities are nice, but not overly done - nice marble and tile baths, not Four Seasons, but you're not paying for the Four Seasons either. The Inn offers a nice continental breakfast, which includes cold cereals, pastries, bagels, etc, and complimentary wine in the evening, white or red, and some cheese and crackers. This was a nice touch after walking around all day, and then you could head off to whatever restaurant you wanted. We are already talking about our trip next year, which will definitely include the Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thouroughly enjoyed my time spend at the Inn at Union Square. Despite being in the middle of it all -- and it *is* really in the middle of it all, it's a great location -- the hotel was never noisy, always quiet, always private. The hotel was very tastefully decorated as well as being extremely comfortable. I slept well the nights I spent here. It was very clean as well.
reviews.title: An oasis in the busy city

likes.disliked: — loading and unloading luggage can be complicated on the busy street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't speak to the evening spreads because we were always out sightseeing, but the morning breakfasts were wonderful. Coffee, tea, oj, milk, granola, yogurt, hardboiled eggs, a variety of pastries, and more.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel in San Francisco

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful. The interactions with them were always a pleasure.
reviews.title: An Absolute Delight

likes.liked: — The personal touches, the staff, the free internet, the location.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inn at Union Square is simply excellent. All aspects well above average - staff, room, facitlies. The continental breakfast, newspaper, and the evening wine-tasting are really special touches that make a visit.
reviews.title: Will never stay anywhere else in SF

likes.disliked: — it was perfect in every way

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and were really delighted with the experience. The rooms were lovely, good size and quiet. The breakfast was good and well presented each morning (the coffee could be improved). We enjoyed the cheese and wine each evening, what a great idea and gets the guests talking to each other. The only things I would like to see an improvement on are the cleaning of the rooms, which wasn't bad but I've seen better and the coffee which wasn't very good. But everything else, including the complimentary bottled water and the chocolates every night was great. I would definitely stay here again, it's in a great area with easy access to transport and lots of good shops. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — Room cleaning could be more thorough

reviews.text: Can't beat the location for convenience to shopping and San Fran sights. My room was a great size with a sitting area, large LCD and comfy bed. Room was clean too and great evening turn down service with chocs and water. Friendly helpful staff. Def recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: What a find.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A warm welcome to an extremely well located hotel just a minutes wald from the main shopping area at union square.
reviews.title: Loved the Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here twice on our holiday, once for 3 nights of sightseeing and once for 1 night on the way back from Yosemite.
reviews.title: More than I expected

aka: The Inn At Union Square Hotel
description: The Inn at Union Square is truly an urban retreat, in classic San Francisco style. The intimacy of our 30 elegant and restful rooms and suites provides the setting for our gracious staff to tend to your every need. From greeting you by name to making sure you have an umbrella when it rains- it is our pleasure to serve you. The Inn is located steps from Union Square- the city’s center for shopping, theatre and dining. If business is on the agenda, it is an easy stroll to the Financial District or the Moscone Convention Center. The Inn at Union Square is away from the crowd, in the center of everything.
